The official syllabus, which gives requirements, learning objectives, and
grading mechanisms, is available [here](https://canvas.wisc.edu/courses/267698/files). This website only includes links to
the reading and lecture content -- the course structure is mapped out fully on
the [Canvas homepage](https://canvas.wisc.edu/courses/267698).

## Readings

Readings refer to the 10th edition^[You may use any edition in this course. For
reference,
[here](https://www.wiley.com/en-us/Design+and+Analysis+of+Experiments%2C+10th+Edition-p-9781119492443#content-section)
is the 10th edition's table of contents.] of *Design and Analysis of
Experiments* by Douglas Montgomery

| Week | Topic | Reading |
| - | --- | -- |
| 1 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/2w0x5hzg03zk8113e3rcto58tocc4y6w.png"/> | Basic principles & examples | 1.1 - 1.4 |
| 2 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/2nue43dk0rw0v25swmbd552qk1bz1jze.png"/> | Sampling distributions, difference in means, pairing | 2.1 - 2.5 |
| 3 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/ka2t5b3awtqt0mqdqtm8o5zbzs8ur7xp.png"/> | ANOVA, model checking, multiple comparisons | 3.1 - 3.5 |
| 4 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/f2e3b39odm4ejkyqinvpii24s9tegnqb.png"/> | Computer examples, random effects, nonparametric approaches | 3.6 - 3.11 (except 3.10) |
| 5 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/fgtpgaimnwwlm5s63bmj9f8ahe1nq4qp.png"/> | Randomized complete block design, Latin Squares design | 4.1 - 4.3 |
| 6 <br/> | Balanced incomplete block designs, and Factorial Design Intro | 4.4.1, 5.1 - 5.2 |
| 7 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/7qgi74t4kkleybceodksuroyaavn9zoq.png"/> | Two and general factorial design, intro to response curves | 5.3 - 5.5 |
| 8 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/hvedijshgaw7so91kqcl1l8eunml4m9v.png"/> | Intro to $2^k$ designs | 6.1 - 6.4 |
| 9 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/wwsniua1ce0q376oy2ffrtzf4ivzup99.png"/> | Examples of $2^k$ designs | 6.5 - 6.6 |
| 10 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/48czl1on1krut0gquz5arqdb5a81ft40.png"/> | Properties of $2^k$ designs, fractional factorial designs | 6.7 - 6.9, 8.1 - 8.2 |
| 11 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/b94hfeyugeun1xywlm2ccls9am5l38xg.jpg"/> | More fractional factorial designs | 8.3 - 8.7 (except 8.5) |
| 12 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/uubzanl5c273c45mxazy0d06r7r0uz52.png"/> | Response surfaces | 11.1 - 11.4.2 |
| 13 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/hxsz37wvxcj93osymlckvep6da6ipoqy.png"/> | More response surfaces | 11.4.3 - 11.6 |
| 14 <br/> <img width=200 src="https://uwmadison.box.com/shared/static/hacac7wv04k9ua657et7hzd8wg1827ln.png"/> | Nested and split plot designs | 14.1 - 14.4 |
